snippet: It is widely accepted that demand among Afghans for better schooling — and the actual opportunity to attend, particularly for girls — is at its highest point in decades.
abstract: Interviews with local Afghan officials, aid workers, teachers and students reveal concerns that the promise of education improvements in Afghanistan is going unfulfilled and problems unsolved; school woes persist despite fact that widely accepted demand among Afghans for better schooling--and actual opportunity to attend, especially for girls--is at its highest point in decades.
lead_paragraph: It is widely accepted that demand among Afghans for better schooling — and the actual opportunity to attend, particularly for girls — is at its highest point in decades.

headline.main: Despite Education Advances, a Host of Afghan School Woes
headline.print_headline: Despite Education Advances, A Host of Afghan School Woes
